DataElement.preferredName: Treatment First Course No Radiation Therapy Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code the reason the patient did not receive radiation treatment as part of first course of therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment First Course No Radiation Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The reason the patient did not receive radiation treatment as part of first course of therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question._Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown if radiation therapy was recommended or administered. Death cert. or autopsy-only cases.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown if radiation therapy was recommended or administered. Death cert. or autopsy-only cases.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
It is unknown if radiation therapy was recommended or administered. Death-certificate-only and
autopsy-only cases.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy was recommended, but it is unknown if it was administered.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation therapy was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation therapy was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this treatment was refused
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Radiation therapy was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but this
treatment was refused by the patient, the patient's family member, or the patient's guardian. The
refusal was noted in the patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation therapy was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of the first-course therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation therapy was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of the first-course therapy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy was not administered; it was recommended by the patient's physician, but was not administered as part of the first-course therapy. No reason was noted in the patient's record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended treatment.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy was not administered because the patient died prior to planned or recommended treatment.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation therapy was not administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation therapy was not administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition:
Radiation therapy was not administered because it was contraindicated due to patient risk factors
(comorbid conditions, advanced age, etc).

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Radiation therapy was not administered because it was not part of the planned first-course treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Radiation therapy was not administered because it was not part of the planned first-course treatment.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy was not administered because it was not part of the planned first-course treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Emission or propagation of electromagnetic energy (waves/rays), or the waves/rays themselves; a stream of electromagnetic particles (electrons, neutrons, protons, alpha particles) or a mixture of these. The most common source is the sun.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences
